Author: Deleted User#0000

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Targeting existing skin markets and in game currency does not make sense yet. We would need to find a better economic model for those game publishers and developers to try and displace that existing model.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: one reason roguelike is interesting is that it is typically a single player. by adding a provably fair and blockchain enforced solution we can now offer a way to have a multiplayer "tournament" mode functionality.

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: Game company A does not trust game company B, but both see the value in being able to exchange assets between their platforms..I don't think it's so much about hiding transactions as creating a neutral database that doesn't require the trust of humans

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: right, i think targeting indie gaming and a way for them to create an interoperable ecosystem would be a good move

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: game betting and anti cheat would be another area to explore

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Avg gamer is an 11 year old. I don‚Äôt think they give a shit about cryptography.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: It‚Äôs just making gaming more complex

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: They shouldn't need to care about cryptography, blockchain would just be the backend for the gaming companies to utilize as a resource imo

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: that is a ux/ui and integration issue, the user shouldn't have to know what the backend is doing

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: It's just like the user doesn't care about servers and all the database infrastructure that games run on

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: Should be the same if adding in crypto, it's just another storage system
